conclusion: The car enters with initial power and moves towards the cubes.
Upon colliding with the cubes, it transfers energy to them, causing them to move and deflecting its own path.
Energy is also lost due to friction.
These repeated collisions and friction slow down the car, dissipating its initial kinetic energy.
As a result, the car will eventually stop within the cluster of colored cubes, in the central-left area where the cubes are located, as its motion is resisted by the presence of these obstacles.
